Class ScheduleResult

java.lang.Object
userInterface.backEnd.ScheduleResult
public class ScheduleResult extends Object
Builds and holds the processed scheduling timeline data for visualization.

ScheduleResult transforms raw per-core SchedulingInfo records produced by the simulator into time-indexed lookup tables and lane models (task or core timelines) that the UI can render. It supports two modes:

  • Core timeline (isCoreTimeLine = true): one CoreTimeLine per core showing EXECUTION / WAIT / CONTEXTSWITCH / MIGRATION intervals.
  • Task timeline (isCoreTimeLine = false): one TaskTimeLine per task (multi‑core case) or a reduced set for single‑core, aggregating intervals where the task's job is active.
Inline comments (Chinese) have been integrated: 排程時間 (simulation time), Dictionary<ID, TaskTimeline / CoreTimeline> describing maps from IDs to timelines, baseunit 比例尺 (horizontal scaling in pixels per time unit), accuracy 時間精準度 (integer granularity used for indexing), and atbSet 儲存記錄佇列 (2‑D array that stores references to scheduling info at each discrete time tick).

Time scaling: simulationTime is derived from the simulator's raw simulation time divided by magnificationFactor. The 2‑D array atbSet is sized as [taskOrCoreIndex][simulationTime * accuracy + 1]. Each cell holds the applicable SchedulingInfo reference for constant‑time retrieval in hover/highlight operations.

Author:
ShiuJia

    Parent viewer which owns this scheduling result and provides cores & scale.

    Returns the vertical gap between task lanes in multi‑core mode.

    Returns the vertical gap between task lanes in single‑core mode.

    Dictionary<String,TaskTimeLine>
    getTaskTimeLines()

    void
    setBaseunit(Double d)
    Adjusts the horizontal scaling factor by multiplying the current base unit by the supplied value.
    void
    startCoreTimeLineSchedule()
    Builds core timelines: allocates CoreTimeLine instances for every core, constructs a time indexed matrix (atbSet) sized by tasks × (simulationTime * accuracy + 1), then iterates each core's scheduling info assigning references into atbSet.
    void
    startTaskTimeLineSchedule()
    Builds task timelines: creates a TaskTimeLine for each task, allocates the time matrix atbSet (multi‑core: size tasks × time; single‑core: size 1 × time), populates references from scheduling info (mapping each interval to the owning task's index), adds execution‑related TaskExecution objects for relevant core statuses, adds deadline miss markers, then prunes timelines with no recorded executions.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • parent

      public ResultViewer parent
      Parent viewer which owns this scheduling result and provides cores & scale.

    • isMultiCore

      public boolean isMultiCore
      True when more than one core is present (multi‑core visualization).

    • isCoreTimeLine

      public boolean isCoreTimeLine
      True when building per‑core timelines; false for task timelines.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScheduleResult

      public ScheduleResult(ResultViewer rv)
      Constructs a scheduling result builder bound to a viewer. Initializes mode flags (multi‑core detection), empty timeline maps, obtains the simulator's ResultSet and computes scaled simulation time.
      Parameters:
      rv - parent result viewer supplying cores and simulator access

  • Method Details

    • startCoreTimeLineSchedule

      public void startCoreTimeLineSchedule()
      Builds core timelines: allocates CoreTimeLine instances for every core, constructs a time indexed matrix (atbSet) sized by tasks × (simulationTime * accuracy + 1), then iterates each core's scheduling info assigning references into atbSet. Finally converts each EXECUTION, WAIT, CONTEXTSWITCH and MIGRATION interval into a TaskExecution and attaches it to the corresponding core timeline.

    • startTaskTimeLineSchedule

      public void startTaskTimeLineSchedule()
      Builds task timelines: creates a TaskTimeLine for each task, allocates the time matrix atbSet (multi‑core: size tasks × time; single‑core: size 1 × time), populates references from scheduling info (mapping each interval to the owning task's index), adds execution‑related TaskExecution objects for relevant core statuses, adds deadline miss markers, then prunes timelines with no recorded executions.

    • getAtbSet

      public SchedulingInfo getAtbSet(int taskID, int time)
      Retrieves the SchedulingInfo reference at a given task index and accuracy‑scaled time tick.
      Parameters:
      taskID - zero‑based (for multi‑core task timelines: taskID-1 matches array row)
      time - discrete time index (scaled by accuracy)
      Returns:
      scheduling info stored at that position (may be the last interval or a null placeholder)

    • getFinalTime

      public double getFinalTime()
      Returns the final (scaled) simulation time used for timeline construction.
      Returns:
      scaled simulation time in time units

    • getTaskTimeLines

      public Dictionary<String,TaskTimeLine> getTaskTimeLines()
      Returns the map of task timelines keyed by task ID (String).
      Returns:
      dictionary of task ID to TaskTimeLine

    • getCoreTimeLines

      public Dictionary<String,CoreTimeLine> getCoreTimeLines()
      Returns the map of core timelines keyed by core ID (String).
      Returns:
      dictionary of core ID to CoreTimeLine

    • getBaseunit

      public int getBaseunit()
      Returns the horizontal scaling base unit in pixels per time unit.
      Returns:
      base unit (pixels per time unit)

    • setBaseunit

      public void setBaseunit(Double d)
      Adjusts the horizontal scaling factor by multiplying the current base unit by the supplied value.
      Parameters:
      d - scale multiplier (values > 1 zoom in, < 1 zoom out)

    • getAccuracy

      public int getAccuracy()
      Returns the time accuracy (number of discrete ticks per time unit).
      Returns:
      accuracy integer

    • getSingleTaskGap

      public int getSingleTaskGap()
      Returns the vertical gap between task lanes in single‑core mode.
      Returns:
      single‑core task lane gap (pixels)

    • getMCTaskGap

      public int getMCTaskGap()
      Returns the vertical gap between task lanes in multi‑core mode.
      Returns:
      multi‑core task lane gap (pixels)

    • getTaskGap

      public int getTaskGap()
      Returns the effective vertical gap based on whether multi‑core mode is active.
      Returns:
      chosen task lane gap (pixels)
